definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: Mr Fini was ostensibly a high-minded mutineer.
sentences.chinese: 菲尼明显是一个高调的反叛者。

sentences.english: I think I had a little streak of rebelliousness too.
sentences.chinese: 我想我有一点反叛连胜了。

sentences.english: How were Victorian sex rebels influenced by religion?
sentences.chinese: 宗教是如何影响维多利亚时代的性反叛？

sentences.english: While in Iraq, Brown processed insurgents and detainees , the NYCLU said.
sentences.chinese: 但在伊拉克，布朗工人反叛者和被拘留者，尼克鲁说。

sentences.english: Ask God to protect your marriage from the damage caused by stubborn or rebellious hearts.
sentences.chinese: 求神保护你们婚姻不受到顽梗和反叛的心的破坏。

sentences.english: THERE was no return of the mutineers - not so much as another shot out of the woods.
sentences.chinese: 反叛者们没有卷土重来，树林中再也没听到枪声。

sentences.english: The rebel held unclaimed with rebel-held enclave is coming under sustained pressure from the armyand .
sentences.chinese: 反叛者现在受到政府军强大的持续性的压力之下。

sentences.english: A military commander says former rebels have him cornered.
sentences.chinese: 一位军事指挥说卡扎菲被前反叛军监禁。

sentences.english: Due to the internal rebellion within the army.
sentences.chinese: 这是由于军队内部的反叛行为。

sentences.english: A bit of the Bohemian rebel, a bit of the noble savage.
sentences.chinese: 带着一点波希米亚式的反叛，还有一点贵族气的粗暴。

sentences.english: The young rebel against traditions subliminally.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人会下意识的反叛传统。

sentences.english: The crew was ready for open rebellion.
After the failure of the coup many of the rebels took to the hills and became guerillas .
sentences.chinese: 政变失败后，许多反叛的人上山打游击去了。

sentences.english: I'm still waiting for the proles to rebel.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在等待后代的反叛。

sentences.english: Most people seemed to have rebel attitudes and social-climbing attitudes all scrambled together.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人似乎将反叛和追逐名利的态度糅杂在了一起。

definition: to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to go on a punitive expedition
to surrender and pay allegiance to
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
(of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government
